title: 113_hr4121
content:
The Small Business Development Centers Improvement Act of 2014, also known as the Small Business Act, authorizes entrepreneurial development programs. The Administrator is required to use specific programs to provide support for entrepreneurs, excluding services for small businesses owned by Indian tribes. Additionally, an annual report must be submitted to the Committee on Small Business. The Administrator must report annually to the Committee on Small Business on entrepreneurial development activities, including program descriptions, operating details, grant award processes, awardees, and funding obligations. The Administrator must report annually to the Committee on Small Business on entrepreneurial development activities, including program descriptions, grant award processes, funding obligations, and responsible individuals for each program and activity. SEC. 3. MARKETING OF SERVICES.

Section 21 of the Small Business Act is amended to allow grant recipients to market their services without prohibition.

SEC. 4. CONFIDENTIALITY REQUIREMENTS.

Section 21(a)(7)(A) of the Small Business Act is amended to include sharing information with State, local, or Federal agencies or third parties.

SEC. 5. DATA COLLECTION. SEC. 5. DATA COLLECTION.

Amends the Small Business Act to include governing data collection activities for grant recipients and requires the Administrator to report annually on data collection related to the Small Business Development Center program. SEC. 6. MATCHMAKING AND OTHER EVENTS. Amends the Small Business Act to allow Small Business Development Centers to collect fees from private partnerships and cosponsorships. SEC. 7. EQUITY FOR SBDCS. Amends the Small Business Act to make changes regarding equity for SBDCs. SEC. 8. AWARD OF GRANTS TO SBDCS. Amends the Small Business Act to address the award of grants to SBDCs. SEC. 8. AWARD OF GRANTS TO SBDCS. The Administrator shall not award grants under this section to entities that did not receive grants prior to September 30, 2014, and seek to renew them after that date. SEC. 9. DISASTER REFORMS. Section 21(b)(3) of the Small Business Act is amended to allow small business development centers to provide assistance to out-of-state small businesses for disaster recovery without geographic limitations. The Small Business Act allows small business development centers to provide disaster recovery assistance to small businesses located in areas declared as major disaster zones by the President under the Stafford Disaster Relief Act. The centers must ensure continuity of services in affected states and provide access to disaster recovery resources. The Small Business Act allows small business development centers to access disaster recovery facilities designated by the Administrator for providing assistance to small businesses in declared disaster zones. SEC. 10. INCLUSIONS OF ENTREPRENEURSHIP TRAINING FOR UNEMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS. Amends the Small Business Act to include educating unemployed individuals on entrepreneurship and assisting them in starting new businesses.
